title: Kids as young as 4 innately use sorting algorithms to solve problems
summary: It was previously thought that children younger than 7 couldn't find efficient solutions to complex problems, but new research suggests that much earlier, children can happen upon known sorting algorithms used by computer scientists

title: الإمارات تحلق بالشركات الناشئة إلى فضاء العالمية
summary: حجزت دولة الإمارات موقعها الفريد في ساحة ريادة الأعمال، وأثبتت أنها لاعب مهم على خارطة الاستثمار العالمية، بفضل قدرتها على الجمع بين الابتكار والفرص الواعدة، الأمر الذي أسهم في تعزيز ثقة المستثمرين وتأكيد مكانتها وجهة مثالية للأعمال.

title: فوربس: ماسك أول شخص تقدر ثروته بنحو 500 مليار دولار
summary: أصبح إيلون ماسك أول شخص يقدر صافي ثروته بـ 500 مليار دولار، وفقا لمجلة فوربس الأميركية، مع تركيز الجزء الأكبر من ثروته على أسهم شركتي صناعة السيارات الكهربائية تسلا وشركة الفضاء سبيس إكس.

title: The best new science fiction books of October 2025
summary: Science fiction legend Ursula K. Le Guin is honoured with a new collection out this month, and sci-fi fans can also look forward to fiction from astronaut Chris Hadfield and award-winning authors Ken Liu and Mary Robinette Kowal

title: مصر تطرح 6 قطع أراض متميزة في القاهرة على المستثمرين
summary: أكدت وزارة المالية المصرية في بيان، حرصها على تعظيم العوائد الناتجة عن استثمار الأراضي الفضاء غير المستغلة، من خلال تحفيز القطاع الخاص على تطوير مشاريع مبتكرة تضيف قيمة اقتصادية وتترك أثرًا إيجابيًا على المناطق المحيطة، إلى جانب خلق فرص عمل جديدة.

title: If you feel you don't really belong, here is some science-based advice
summary: Thinking you don’t fit in is agonising, whether you are starting at university or changing jobs. Our advice columnist, David Robson, shares some tips to change how you feel

title: Device with 6100 qubits is a step towards largest quantum computer yet
summary: An array of 6100 ultracold caesium atoms controlled by lasers is the largest collection of qubits ever assembled, and researchers hope they can soon turn it into the world's most advanced quantum computer

title: How faster-than-light explosions could reveal the universe’s secrets
summary: Some things we see in space appear to outpace light. Now we are learning to harness these bizarre optical illusions to understand the mysteries of neutron stars, gamma ray bursts and more

title: Dinosaur found with a crocodile in its jaws named as new species
summary: A fossil from about 66 million years ago reveals a species of dinosaur that is new to science, with claws that would have ripped through its prey's flesh

title: The truth about narcissists: How to handle them, and can they change?
summary: Although narcissistic personality disorder is rarer than you might think, psychological research suggests it can come in two different types, one of which may be underdiagnosed

title: Quantum computers have finally achieved unconditional supremacy
summary: For the first time, researchers have mathematically proven that a quantum computer needs less computational power to solve a particular task than an ordinary computer, in a way that can never be beaten

title: The science revealing how the right diet can add a decade to your life
summary: Evidence shows that eating a longevity diet can dramatically lengthen your lifespan – and the sooner you start, the more of a difference it makes

title: Telling incoming aliens from space rocks… on a scale of 1 to 10!
summary: Feedback is mystified by a new way to assess interstellar visitors and the risks they pose, be they lumps of ice or alien craft. Just pray they don’t top out on the Loeb Scale
